subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Out of body? Spirit walking.
author: Tracy
full_text:
--0-1437892411-1191127054=:11234
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

I've had spontaneous out of body experiences my whole life.  Can't say I've ever had this particular experience, but I have fallen off my bed, only to stand up to get back in bed and my body was lying there.  lol.

Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...> wrote:            Just kicking around some thoughts in my head, and nobody is up tonight to share thier ideas so I am writing it down anyway while it's fresh in my thoughts. 
   
  I know and understand pretty well about OOB's and have read peoples experiences. So far all of my disembodied experiences were while I was "unconcious" with little to verify any of the experiences as being anything but a dream state. However lately I have begun to do something again that I havent done since I was a small child. 
   
  You know how it is when you wake up in the morning hit the snooze button, roll over and lay there thinking..... man I dont want to get up right now I am soooo comfortable. Well lets just say I do that alot even tho I usually get up before the next alarm hits in a few minutes I still press it, roll over and lay there for a minute LOL. Some people hit the coffee machine.. i hit the snooze.
   
  However, lately I am rolling over, but the body seems to stay still turned the other way. I used to do it often when I was a kid I would wake up in a totally different position than I thought I was laying in when I had my eyes closed. I'd think I was layin on my stomache and realize I was flat on my back or on my side. With gravity its pretty easy to feel which end is facing down and once I am fully alert its a little disorientating at first. I am curious if anybody else has that experience, including those who travel out of body at will.
   
  Misty
    
---------------------------------
